intro: Dunbaria ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty dunbaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions. Dunbaria ferruginea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
